subject: Re: [junit] How to write test cases for Server side Utility Classes??
msgSnippet: Thanks Paul. Will look in to the tool and let u know any concerns . Mahen
messageBody:
Thanks Paul. Will look in to the tool and let u know any concerns .

Mahen


On Tue, 29 Mar 2005 09:17:55 +1000, Paul King <paulk@...> wrote:
>
>
> For your simple scenario, I would recommend junitee:
>
> http://www.junitee.org/
>
> You write a normal junit test as if it was local
> and junitee will let you run it remotely. It has a
> nice browser interface which lets you select which
> test(s) you want to run and shows you the result.
>
> Paul.
>
> mahensp2003 wrote:
> >
> >
> > Hi
> >
> > I have this class which is a Utility class (A property Reader)in the
> > server side. It will be accessed by Server side components to read
> > various property values using JNDI.
> >
> > Whass the best approach to write a test case for this class? specially
> > taking in to consideration the fact that this class needs to be in a
> > particular App Server Container to access the container environment.
> >
> > Thanks for any ideas
> >
> > Please help
> >
> > Mahen
